related_questions.question: What does a solar energy technician do?
related_questions.snippet: Definition and Nature of the Work These technicians install, maintain, operate, and test equipment and energy systems that use solar energy. Each solar energy project, from conception to installation, requires the services of many technicians with various skills.

related_questions.question: How much do solar panel installers get paid?
related_questions.snippet: A Solar Photovoltaic Installer will normally receive an average salary ranging between 32000 to 48000 depending on experience and domain knowledge. Solar Photovoltaic Installers will normally get a wage of Forty Eight Thousand Seven Hundred dollars per annum.

related_questions.question: What do you need to be a solar energy technician?
related_questions.snippet: Solar energy engineers are required to hold at least a bachelor's degree, typically in mechanical or electrical engineering.

related_questions.question: How much does a wind turbine technician make a year?
related_questions.snippet: Wind Turbine Technicians made a median salary of $53,880 in 2017. The best-paid 25 percent made $66,330 that year, while the lowest-paid 25 percent made $44,550.

answer_box.title: Pay Scale for a Solar Energy Technician | Chron.com
answer_box.snippet: National Average Pay According to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics, the lowest-paid 10 percent of solar technicians earned $12.62 or less per hour and $26,250 or less per year, while the highest-paid 10 percent made $27.88 or more an hour and reported annual incomes of $57,980 or above.
